One of my favorite games of all time. Simple, yet so much fun.

However, I strongly recommend buying Left 4 Dead 2 instead. That game automatically includes all of this game's maps now, and a setting that doesn't allow the special infected introduced into the second game to spawn. That means it will play exactly like the first game. L4D2 also has a much more active online community than this game does.

There are only two real reasons you'd want to buy this game over Left 4 Dead 2. You want to go for the achievements that are associated with this game, or you hate the fact that your gun melee hit to push zombies back can only be used a certain amount of times within a short time frame before getting tired and doing it slower.
Good game. Buy the second one over this one though since it got the more content and has these campaign missions included as well
Better than L4D2, but not moddable :( (unlike L4D2)

All-time classis zombie fighting game.

I loved L4D2 and bought L4D1 when it was on sale (1€). Great offer and totally worth it. The gameplay is sick and the graphics are still fine.

Huge fun to replay this old pearl. You will have lots of fun playing this with your friends.

Nevertheless, I recommend buying L4D2 as you will have the same maps and much more.

fun, old school gaming. definitely recommend.

No hay mucho que decir de este gran clasico que todos conocen !! es un título excelente, que ofrece una experiencia cinemática que es intensa con una elevada dosis de acción y suspenso. Resaltando especialmente la sobresaliente ambientación, tanto visual como sonora.
Nunca antes matar zombies o infectados como en este caso había resultado tan divertido y frenético. Nunca a un grupo al que habían dado por muerto, había presentado tanta guerra, y como reza el póster de la pantalla de carga de la campaña Alta médica: "Curan la infección… Con jarabe de plomo"....   un juegazo con puntuación 10 de 10 totalmente recomendado !!

Left 4 Dead is one of the ultimate co-op games, and home to some of my fondest teen memories.
Never again did a game about watching each-others' backs and progressing safely had such a smooth feel.
Definitely play this one before L4D2, as many features in the L4D1 levels were broken when ported to the sequel.
